Posted By: Weretarrasque (7/25/2009 8:35:58 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
There is something I don't understand flavour wise: With demon's herald, you make a blood sacrifice to summon a demon, something that fits the demonic type perfectly.
  
With this card however, you are make a blood sacrifice to summon an ANGEL(!?), I mean, isn't that completely off for an angel to require a blood sacrifice? Aren't angels supposed to be the protectors of the innocent of something like that?
  
Furthermore, the flavour text has nothing to do with the card, it is not rigoruous faith and belief that is rewarded, it is spilling the blood of your own soldiers that is rewarded.
  
I know this may seem irrelevant to most people, but it just really seems odd to me. Can someone explain the flavour in this? Is it a martyr thing, meaning that those who have their blood spilled are "rewarded" with being part in the summoning of an angel?
posts.html:

With this card however, you are make a blood sacrifice to summon an ANGEL(!?), I mean, isn't that completely off for an angel to require a blood sacrifice? Aren't angels supposed to be the protectors of the innocent of something like that?
Furthermore, the flavour text has nothing to do with the card, it is not rigoruous faith and belief that is rewarded, it is spilling the blood of your own soldiers that is rewarded.
I know this may seem irrelevant to most people, but it just really seems odd to me. Can someone explain the flavour in this? Is it a martyr thing, meaning that those who have their blood spilled are "rewarded" with being part in the summoning of an angel?

posts.post_content: I would play this cycle of cards as removal bait. If you play one of these guys early on and at least pretend to have the mythic rare in your deck, your opponent will probably waste a bolt or a doom blade on it before you can "activate" it, even if you don't have a single copy of the mythic in your deck

posts.post_content:
Uhg...i hate these cards. I loves [SPirit of the nigh](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=SPirit of the nigh ) and friends, I even liked [Peer through depths](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Peer through depths) and CO, but FIVE sets of this type of card at UNCOMMON in ONE set. This cycle right here is one of the biggest reasons I only bought singles from this set. I normally buy boxes upon boxes of sets to get a commmon/uncommon playset, but these cards took alot of value out of Alara's uncommon slots.
  
   
They are kind of playable, but the card disadvantage is barely worth it.

posts.post_content:
There is something I don't understand flavour wise: With demon's herald, you make a blood sacrifice to summon a demon, something that fits the demonic type perfectly.
  
With this card however, you are make a blood sacrifice to summon an ANGEL(!?), I mean, isn't that completely off for an angel to require a blood sacrifice? Aren't angels supposed to be the protectors of the innocent of something like that?
  
Furthermore, the flavour text has nothing to do with the card, it is not rigoruous faith and belief that is rewarded, it is spilling the blood of your own soldiers that is rewarded.
  
I know this may seem irrelevant to most people, but it just really seems odd to me. Can someone explain the flavour in this? Is it a martyr thing, meaning that those who have their blood spilled are "rewarded" with being part in the summoning of an angel?
